answers.answer: Sorry to hear you are not feeling well.  Sounds like you are frustrated and looking for more answers.  While I've never heard that anxiety can cause edema, some of the other causes are prolonged standing and being overweight.  While edema can occur elsewhere, the ankles and legs are typical spots for the fluid to buildup.Type II diabetes and smoking are definite no-no's when it comes to heart disease.  Have you thought about trying to get on an exercise program?  Once you have your doctor's clearance, maybe you could set up some sort of walking plan.  How 'bout tossing the cigarettes?  Any chance you can get some help to try and break the habit?  Eating a balanced diet, exercising and practicing overall wellness techniques may even help with the diabetes and the edema.  Discuss your options with your physician and see if the two of you can come up with some sort of workable plan that you can build upon.As I'm sure you are aware, chest pain, arm pain, jaw pain, shortness of breath and other symptoms can be associated with the heart OR with anxiety.  If you are confident with your physician's assessment, consider the wellness plan and see if that helps.  Good luck!  Take care.
